1.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a magistrate (as deciding) or other leader
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

2.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
flesh (as swelling out), as living or forfood; generally food of any kind; figuratively, kindred by blood
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame

3.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
flesh (as swelling out), as living or forfood; generally food of any kind; figuratively, kindred by blood
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to spread out (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to strip (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a pot; also a thorn (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a hook
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre

4.brief: at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)

5.brief: properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
to say (used with great latitude)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a prophet or (generally) inspired man
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to strike with a sting (as a serpent); figuratively, to oppress with interest on a loan
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to be (causatively, make, pronounce or observe as) clean (ceremonially or morally)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

6.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle
to be dark (as withholding light); transitively, to darken
properly, to distribute, i.e. determine by lot or magical scroll; by implication, to divine
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to be ashy, i.e. darkcolored; by implication, to mourn (in sackcloth or sordid garments)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

7.brief: properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
a beholder in vision; also a compact (as looked upon with approval)
to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach
properly, to distribute, i.e. determine by lot or magical scroll; by implication, to divine
to wrap, i.e. cover, veil, cloth, or roll
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

8.brief: to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to knot or distort; figuratively, to pervert (act or declare perverse)

10.brief: Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

11.brief: the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a donation (venal or redemptive)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
price, payment, wages
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
a prophet or (generally) inspired man
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
properly, to distribute, i.e. determine by lot or magical scroll; by implication, to divine

to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

a circumstance (as rolled around); only used adverbially, on account of
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees)
